image.altText: A birds eye view of a mill with lots of buildings and timber yards

props.synopsis: A major timber mill in regional South Australia has been shut as authorities investigate the death of a worker at the site.

title.children: Major SA timber mill shut as authorities investigate early morning death of worker on site

image.altText: A man in a t-shirt standing in a room with his arms crossed

props.synopsis: After losing 98 per cent of his vision, Ben Pettingill found it difficult to adjust but "put on a brave face" and bottled up how he was feeling. Now he's on a mission to raise awareness, and funds, for men's mental health.

title.children: Blind runner travels across Australia raising money for men's counselling service

image.altText: A man standing in a park

props.synopsis: Twenty-six years after Phyllis Harrison was stabbed to death at her home in Adelaide's north, her family have given evidence in the trial of her alleged killer, accused triple-murderer Steven Leslie Hainsworth.

title.children: 11yo boy found grandmother's murdered body, court hears

image.altText: A firefighter regards a small four-wheel drive that has crashed through the wall of a building.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the cause of a crash that left the hospital south of Adelaide badly damaged and four people with minor injuries.

title.children: Car crashes into Victor Harbor hospital moments after worker leaves desk

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks in front of a Government of South Australia banner

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide Football Club chair David Koch has issued a call for SA's two AFL clubs to work together to take the "nastiness" out of the Showdown, after last weekend's match was marred by incidents both on and off the field.

title.children: Power and Crows should take 'the sting out of the Showdown', Koch says

image.altText: A medium close-up shot of ABC managing director David Anderson speaking into a microphone in a radio studio.

props.synopsis: Mr Anderson says he will remain in the role until a new managing director is appointed at the request of ABC chair Kim Williams.

title.children: ABC managing director David Anderson resigns after almost six years at helm of national broadcaster

image.altText: Monash IVF sign

props.synopsis: More than 700 patients filed a class action against the fertility company, claiming potentially viable embryos were wrongfully discarded and misused.

title.children: Monash IVF agrees to $56m settlement over alleged improper use of patient embryos

image.altText: A man with a beard holds a young child with houses in the background

props.synopsis: Edward Gilmore hoped to be living in his new home by the time his first-born child was ready to take his first steps. Four years after he signed the contract – and with an extra child now in tow – his family are finally moving in.

title.children: First home buyers left in the lurch after building company collapse finally moving in

image.altText: A man bows before a crowd

props.synopsis: With Oprah sneaking in for a surprise address and Bill Clinton returning to the spotlight, Tim Walz enjoyed a star-studded opening act before he made his debut. This is what you missed on day three of the Democratic convention.

title.children: Oprah sneaks into the convention in a mask and Tim Walz makes his big debut: Inside day three of DNC

image.altText: Bemir Saracevic

props.synopsis: The federal government has ordered an investigation after the ABC uncovered allegations of bikie threats towards the CFMEU on a major taxpayer-funded project in Brisbane.

title.children: Federal government orders investigation into alleged bikie threats towards CFMEU

image.altText: Anthony Albanese during QT

props.synopsis: The final Question Time of this sitting period has begun as paid parental leave legislation is introduced to parliament. Follow live.

title.children: Question Time begins as Labor lauds NDIS and paid parental leave changes

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Greens accuse Labor of prioritising surplus over disability community
Defence not commenting on use of Australian donated Bushmasters inside Russia

image.altText: Surfers and swimmers in the water at Bondi Beach in calm conditions.

props.synopsis: Above-average temperatures are forecast all across Australia as we reach the tail end of winter. But is the cold weather truly behind us?

title.children: Summer heat arrives in August, threatening to break all-time Australian winter temperature records

image.altText: Aftermath of missile attack in Russia's Kursk

props.synopsis: Russia's Ministry of Defence says it shot down a swathe of Ukrainian drones in one of Kyiv's "largest attempts" to attack Moscow using drones.

title.children: Kyiv's Russian counteroffensive continues with 'largest' attempted drone attack

image.altText: Pink roses.

props.synopsis: A bouquet of flowers is the go-to gift for many special occasions but the world is paying a high price for transporting our out-of-season blooms.

title.children: The ugly truth behind the cheap flowers we buy at the supermarket checkout

image.altText: Drone shot of the top of a house without a roof.

props.synopsis: A class action has been filed against the West Australian government on behalf of thousands of tenants living in substandard public housing in remote Aboriginal communities.

title.children: These Australians have been 'ignored and forgotten' in the housing crisis

image.altText: An inflatable slide attached to the side of a Jetstar aeroplane.

props.synopsis: The flight from Sydney had just parked at Melbourne Airport when a man opened an emergency exit door, in a situation a passenger described as "really strange".

title.children: Jetstar passenger describes how man 'ripped off' plane's emergency exit door at Melbourne Airport

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: There are fresh warnings that Australia's economy is heading toward a recession, as Deloitte flags a private sector hiring freeze. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Bank of Queensland confirms 400 job cuts, ASX to open higher despite economy warnings

image.altText: Two graves dug in dusty ground are adorned with flowers at a funeral in Nir Oz.

props.synopsis: Avraham Munder was among the 70 people taken hostage during the October 7 attack on his kibbutz, and he has now finally been laid to rest alongside his son by grieving and angry family and loved ones.

title.children: He spent 10 months in captivity in Gaza and died in mysterious circumstances. Now Avraham has been laid to rest

image.altText: Bill Shorten during QT

props.synopsis: The federal government has cleared its political hurdle with states and territories to reform the NDIS, but it now faces a very apprehensive disability community.

title.children: What happens now the government has support for its contentious NDIS reforms?

image.altText: A shot of the horizon with a massive column of water and air running vertically

props.synopsis: A weather phenomenon called a waterspout may have sunk a luxury yacht off Italy this week. But these dangerous spirals of water also happen a lot closer to home.

title.children: Could a waterspout really sink a luxury yacht? Everything you need to know about the rare weather phenomenon

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and his government stand up in parliament with their hands clasped, looking solemn.

props.synopsis: Beyond the heat in the chamber, the two sides of politics have been quietly working together behind the scenes on important reforms.

title.children: Beyond the arguments and name-calling, the two sides of politics have been quietly working together

image.altText: Donald Trump stands behind bullletproof glass onstage at an outdoor rally.

props.synopsis: At his first outdoor rally since last month's attempted assassination, Donald Trump spoke from behind bulletproof glass, but he also casually wandered out to greet crowds.

title.children: Trump speaks behind bulletproof glass at first outdoor rally since attempted assassination

image.altText: O'Neill is sitting in the Senate chamber with a finger raised and calling out to the government benches.

props.synopsis: Taiwan's de facto embassy in Canberra praises Australia after the Senate passed a bipartisan motion criticising China's attempts to use a 50-year-old UN resolution to claim Taiwan as part of its territory.

title.children: Australia backs Taiwan in Senate motion likely to infuriate China

image.altText: A regional express airplane

props.synopsis: Hundreds of former Rex employees could face an even longer wait to be paid their entitlements after administrators applied for an extension to find a buyer for the airline.

title.children: Rex administrators seek to extend sales process for troubled airline

image.altText: Five rescue workers sit in high-viz outfits on a boat

props.synopsis: The discoveries bring the number of people killed in the incident to six, with authorities still searching for one other passenger.

title.children: Five bodies found in billionaire Mike Lynch's superyacht, which sank off Italian coast

image.altText: A person looks out at steam rising from a volcano.

props.synopsis: Volcanic ash has disrupted flight paths for nearby airports after an eruption at Whakaari.

title.children: At least 10 flights cancelled after volcanic ash, eruption at Whakaari White Island

image.altText: Group of penguins stand near inflatable rainbow

props.synopsis: Sphen the gentoo penguin made international headlines in 2018 after entering a same-sex relationship with fellow penguin Magic, who he raised two chicks with.

title.children: World-famous penguin known for same-sex love story dies at Sydney aquarium

image.altText: Micaela Cronin stares up on stage at the national press club.

props.synopsis: Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commissioner Micaela Cronin addressed the National Press Club on Wednesday facing a room almost entirely of women, but it seemed she was trying to reach the ears of a different demographic.

title.children: Australia just got graded on how it's tackling violence against women, and it's a C-

image.altText: A handcuffed man speaks to a crowd with microphones

props.synopsis: Romania's anti-organised crime agency said it was searching the homes over allegations of human trafficking, the trafficking of minors alongside other charges.

title.children: Romanian police launch fresh raids on the homes of controversial influencer Andrew Tate

image.altText: A wide shot of the booking.com website on a laptop with a person sitting in front.

props.synopsis: Online platforms have made it easier and cheaper to organise accommodation, but their rise in popularity has also led to a spike in scams. Here's how to check if your booking is legitimate, and how to avoid being scammed in the first place.

title.children: How to know if your accommodation booking is a scam

image.altText: A portrait photo of Elon Musk. He is a white man with short black hair and brown eyes, wearing a black suit.

props.synopsis: Data provided exclusively to the ABC shows Tesla's "brand health" in Australia has plummeted as some EV buyers say, "Musk has convinced me I don't want to buy a Tesla".

title.children: Does Tesla have a Musk problem? Data shows its reputation in Australia is tanking as sales fall

image.altText: Taylor Swift performs at Wembley Stadium as part of her Eras Tour in a sparkly bodysuit

props.synopsis: In her first comments since the shows were cancelled due to a foiled terror plot, Taylor Swift has explained her decision to keep silent until the European leg wrapped up.

title.children: Taylor Swift explains her silence after Vienna Eras Tour cancellations

image.altText: Pile of frozen pea packets

props.synopsis: Supermarkets are seemingly offering more brands of frozen veggies than ever — but is the increasing choice an illusion?

title.children: The rise of 'phantom brands' as supermarket giants sneak imports onto shelves, pushing Australian produce out

image.altText: A graphic of a street with streetlights changing their intensity. Stars in the sky become more visible as the lights are dimmed.

props.synopsis: An "adaptive lighting" project in Canberra, which reduced the brightness of streetlights by up to half, showed a 25 per cent reduction in light pollution.

title.children: Turning down streetlights at night shown to reduce light pollution and carbon emissions
